summary: This document is a confidential response from MoneyGram to a subpoena dated August 16, 2019, issued by the FBI. It details the results of searches conducted for specific individuals and email addresses related to wire transfers and online accounts, finding no matching transactions or accounts within the specified seven-year period.

persons.name: Law Enforcement Liaison
persons.context: The signatory of the response letter, representing MoneyGram in communications with law enforcement regarding the subpoena.

events.title: Issuance of Subpoena
events.description: The FBI issued a subpoena to MoneyGram, likely as part of the Epstein investigation, requesting information on specific individuals and email addresses.

events.title: MoneyGram's Subpoena Response
events.description: MoneyGram responded to the FBI subpoena, reporting that searches for specified names, addresses, identification numbers, telephone numbers, and an email address yielded no results for transactions or accounts from August 16, 2012, to August 16, 2019.

keyFacts: The FBI subpoenaed MoneyGram on August 16, 2019, as part of the Epstein investigation, seeking financial transaction records.
MoneyGram searched its databases for specific individuals and an email address but found no matching wire transfers or online accounts from August 16, 2012, to August 16, 2019.
The search was limited to exact spelling matches; variations or typographical errors would prevent identification of transactions or accounts.
MoneyGram does not maintain records of individuals who purchased or cashed money orders, limiting the scope of information it could provide.
